page.title: 04Family Life in Old Coulsdon
page.content: My mum gets home on the 5.40pm train from London to Caterham, whilst my father drives home in the car. I get home,get changed and load a couple of programs into my Commodore 64 computer. My mother makes the tea for us in the microwave which only takes a fraction of the normal time. Afterwards we either watch television or watch some of our tapes on the video recorder. This is very handy because if one of us wants to watch one programme,but then finds that there is another programme on which we want to watch we can record it.
